entry.title: Row: 2
entry.content: speakertitle: Ade Oshineye, speakercompany: Developer Advocate, speakerabstract: Ade Oshineye is a Developer Advocate in Google's London office. He's interested in the protocols and technologies that power the social web. He'd love to show you how social features can make your software better. Over the last decade he's worked on trading systems for a variety of investment banks as well as on Google's Ads and mobile search systems. He's also the co-author of Apprenticeship Patterns: a book that teaches you how to learn to be a great programmer.

entry.title: Row: 3
entry.content: speakertitle: Alexei Masterov, speakercompany: Product Manager, speakerabstract: Alexei Masterov is a Product Manager on Google Chrome Developer Tools team. He is passionate about helping web developers build better, faster web sites and web applications. Prior to Google he worked on Wall Street, as well as served as a consultant in information security space. He holds a Masters degree from Columbia University.

entry.title: Row: 4
entry.content: speakertitle: Brad Chen, speakercompany: Product Manager, speakerabstract: J. Bradley Chen manages the Native Client project at Google, where he has also worked on cluster performance analysis projects. Prior to joining Google, he was Director of the Performance Tools Lab in Intel's Software Products Division. Chen served on the faculty of Harvard University from 1994-1998, conducting research in operating systems, computer architecture and distributed system, and teaching a variety of related graduate and undergraduate courses. He has published widely on the subjects of systems performance and computer architecture. Dr. Chen has bachelors and masters degrees from Stanford University and a Ph.D. from Carnegie Mellon University.

entry.title: Row: 5
entry.content: speakertitle: Chewy Trewhella, speakercompany: ..., speakerabstract: ...

entry.title: Row: 6
entry.content: speakertitle: Chris Chabot, speakercompany: Developer Advocate, speakerabstract: Chris is a Developer Advocate at Google, who's interested in the social web, open source, OpenSocial, and trying to do the impossible. Most recently he's been working on the Google Buzz API's and driving the various open standards that make a distributed, open social web possible. Previous escapades include writing various server implementations for social platforms like OpenSocial.

entry.title: Row: 7
entry.content: speakertitle: Christian Dupuis, speakercompany: ..., speakerabstract: ...

entry.title: Row: 8
entry.content: speakertitle: Christian Kurzke, speakercompany: Developer Advocate, speakerabstract: Christian is Developer Advocate for the Google Android Platform, and has recently been focusing on Android for Google TV. He is an Open Source enthusiast, committer in the Eclipse Foundation and has been working at the intersection of Linux and Java since the early 90es. Prior to Google, Christian worked in Motorola's Mobile Phone and Settop Box divisions. Before that, Christian was at SUN working on Java for Embedded Systems. He holds a Dipl. Inf. degree from Univ. Erlangen, Germany, and an MBA from Santa Clara University.

entry.title: Row: 9
entry.content: speakertitle: Claudio Cherubino, speakercompany: Developer Programs Engineer, speakerabstract: Claudio is a Developer Programs Engineer working on Google Apps APIs. When he is not coding or supporting third-party developers he enjoys contributing to various open-source projects.

entry.title: Row: 10
entry.content: speakertitle: Dan Galpin, speakercompany: Developer Advocate, speakerabstract: Dan Galpin is a Developer Advocate for the Google Android team focused on Games/OpenGL, which implies being able to work both with the Dalvik and NDK environments. Before joining Google, Dan had been working extensively with Android; He developed several Android media applications, created an Android instructional video, and was a technical reviewer for a popular Android book. He has spent the last ten years working in the mobile space, developing at almost every layer of the phone stack. In his spare time, he performs with local opera companies.

entry.title: Row: 11
entry.content: speakertitle: David Springer, speakercompany: tbc, speakerabstract: David Springer is the Team Lead for the Native Client SDK project at Google (see http://nativeclient-sdk.googlecode.com). Prior to joining Google, David worked at Apple developing OpenGL profiling and analysis tools. Prior to Apple, David worked at NeXT Computer developing the 3D aspects of NeXTSTEP. Prior to Next, David was a founder of Alias Resarch, Inc and developed the Alias Power Animator system.

entry.title: Row: 12
entry.content: speakertitle: Don Dodge, speakercompany: Developer Advocate, speakerabstract: Don's focus is on helping developers work with Google Apps. Don joined Google after 5 years as a developer evangelist at Microsoft. Don is a veteran of five start-ups including Forte Software, AltaVista, Napster, Bowstreet, and Groove Networks and has been in the software business for more than 25 years. Don spent 5 years at Microsoft working with VCs and start-ups in the greater Boston area.

entry.title: Row: 13
entry.content: speakertitle: Dr. Jens Trapp, speakercompany: Customer Solution Engineer, speakerabstract: Jens Trapp joined Google in Hamburg in July 2007. As a Customer Solution Engineer he helps clients to integrate products and technologies such as Google AdWords or Google Maps by using API's. Jens studied mathematics with special interest in computer graphics. He obtained a PhD from the University of Göttingen in coorporation with the German Aerospace Institute. Prior to Google Jens worked for Sun Microsystems as a Software Architect on Java and XML projects and technologies.

entry.title: Row: 14
entry.content: speakertitle: Dr. Wieland Holfelder, speakercompany: Engineering Director, speakerabstract: Dr. Wieland Holfelder joined Google in 2008 and oversees Google's engineering activities in Germany. Prior to Google, Wieland Holfelder was vice president and CTO of Mercedes-Benz Research and Technology North America, Inc. Previously, he worked for ICAST Cooperation and FVC, two streaming Internet video companies. As part of his Ph.D. research, Wieland worked at IBM's European Networking Center in Heidelberg, Germany and the International Computer Science Institute in Berkeley, CA. He holds a master’s in computer science and economics and a doctorate in computer science from the University of Mannheim, Germany.

entry.title: Row: 15
entry.content: speakertitle: Eric Tholome, speakercompany: Product Management Director, Developer Products, speakerabstract: Eric joined Google Zurich in 2007 as Product Management Director for Europe, the Middle East, and Africa (EMEA) for Apps products including YouTube, Gmail, Calendar and Docs. Since June 2009, he has been Product Management Director of Developer products in Mountain View. Before Google, Eric worked for Handspring and Palm as Product Line Manager for EMEA. Eric has numerous publications to his credit including a pioneering book on MIDI technology, a GSM technology primer for users, and a contribution to a major guide to telephony. Eric graduated from the Ecole Centrale de Paris in 1990 with a degree in Engineering, and obtained a Masters in Electrical Engineering from Stanford University in 1991. He is fluent in English and French.

entry.title: Row: 16
entry.content: speakertitle: Fred Sauer, speakercompany: Developer Advocate, speakerabstract: Fred Sauer is a Developer Advocate at Google where most of his time is devoted to Google App Engine and Google-Web-Toolkit. He is the author of various GWT related open source projects including gwt-dnd (providing in browser Drag and Drop capabilities), gwt-log (an advanced logging framework) and gwt-voices (for cross browser sound support). Fred has dedicated much of his career to Java related development, with an increasing focus on Web 2.0 technologies. As a consultant he has worked on a wide variety of projects in North America, Asia and Europe, primarily in the financial and billing industry.

entry.title: Row: 17
entry.content: speakertitle: Jeremy Orlow, speakercompany: Software Engineer, speakerabstract: Jeremy Orlow is a Software Engineer on the Google Chrome team. He’s been involved in the development of many HTML5 APIs, and his experience ranges from working on W3C specifications all the way to their implementations within Chrome and WebKit. In the past, Jeremy has also worked on the Windows Kernel, carrier grade VPN products, and data center testing infrastructure. He holds a bachelors degree in Computer Science from Purdue University.

entry.title: Row: 18
entry.content: speakertitle: Julian Toledo, speakercompany: Developer Advocate, speakerabstract: Julian is an Adwords Developer Advocate at Google. He can help you integrate your products with our AdWords platform. Prior to his AdWords role, he also worked to improve our search index in EMEA and assist developers integrating with Google Apps.

entry.title: Row: 19
entry.content: speakertitle: Justin Mattson, speakercompany: Developer Advocate, speakerabstract: Justin Mattson is a Developer Advocate and has been working on the Android project for the last two and a half years. During that time he's spoken at a number of conferences and events, mainly about application performance optimization and compatibility. He is very excited about enabling third party apps to work together to produce unexpected delight for users. Before switching to Android he worked on the AdSense API where he wrote the first PHP library for that API. Justin holds a bachelors degree in Computer Science from Boston University.

entry.title: Row: 20
entry.content: speakertitle: Malte Uble, speakercompany: Customer Solution Engineer, speakerabstract: By the time we all meet for GDD in Munich Malte will have been with Google for about one month. Before that he was building websites for Germany's leading web agency SinnerSchrader generally writing lots of JavaScript and doing other awesome things. He's one of the curators of the infamous and notorious JSConf.eu JavaScript conference and generally likes to spend his time creating things. When he is not coding for money, he is currently busy building the HTML5 based real time Twitter client Streamie.

entry.title: Row: 21
entry.content: speakertitle: Mano Marks, speakercompany: Developer Advocate, speakerabstract: Mano Marks has been on Google’s Developer Relations team for the last four years, and is the lead Developer Advocate for Google’s Geo APIs. He has travelled the world helping individuals, corporations, governments and aid organizations use Google’s mapping technologies to communicate their message to the world. Before Google, Mano had an eclectic career that involved getting a Masters in History, a Masters in Information Management and Systems, and working as a data manager in NGOs for over a decade.

entry.title: Row: 22
entry.content: speakertitle: Maxime Tiran, speakercompany: Customer Solution Engineer, speakerabstract: Maxime has been a Google Customer Solution Engineer based in Paris for over 2 years. He supports large advertisers using Google's tools and APIs such as AdWords API and Maps API. He has extensive experience working on search engines and web 2.0 application development. Prior to Google, he spent 6 years working at IBM Silicon Valley Lab.

entry.title: Row: 23
entry.content: speakertitle: Michael Mahemoff, speakercompany: Developer Advocate, speakerabstract: Michael Mahemoff is a Chrome Developer Advocate for Google, based in London and covering the EMEA region, always looking at ways to make the web a more habitable place for users and developers alike. He’s been programming on the web since the mid ’90s and is the author of Ajax Design Patterns (O’Reilly, 2006) and a blogger for Ajaxian.com. Server side, he worked with Java in the past and is mostly a Ruby, PHP, and NodeJS guy these days. Michael holds a PhD from the University of Melbourne, covering software design patterns for improving user experience.

entry.title: Row: 24
entry.content: speakertitle: Mike Aizatsky, speakercompany: Software Engineer, speakerabstract: Mike is a software engineer working on Google App Engine. He worked on Google Code Search prior to joining the App Engine team. Before joining Google, he was a Project Manager at JetBrains working on developer tools.

entry.title: Row: 25
entry.content: speakertitle: Nick Butcher, speakercompany: Developer Advocate, speakerabstract: Nick is a Developer Advocate at Google working with AdWords API developers. He can help you to use Google APIs to promote your products and attract users. He has a passion for mobile technologies and the social web and has completed over 10 triathlons.

entry.title: Row: 26
entry.content: speakertitle: Patrick Chanezon, speakercompany: Manager, Developer Relations, speakerabstract: Patrick Chanezon joined Google in 2005, he manages the Cloud and Tools Developer Relations team in San Francisco. Previously he has been a Developer Advocate, building and growing developer ecosystems for HTML5, OpenSocial, Google Checkout and the AdWords API, and worked as a software architect at Sun Microsystems, AOL, Netscape and Accenture. More on his blog at http://wordpress.chanezon.com/ or his tweeter stream at http://twitter.com/chanezon

entry.title: Row: 27
entry.content: speakertitle: Paul Kinlan, speakercompany: Developer Advocate, speakerabstract: Paul Kinlan is a Developer Advocate for Chrome at Google. Paul has a passion to help developers build awesome applications on the web. Prior to Google he worked in the telecoms industry building industry leading voice enabled applications and earlier was a Software Engineer for Experian helping develop global fraud detection systems.

entry.title: Row: 28
entry.content: speakertitle: Pavel Feldman, speakercompany: Software Engineer, speakerabstract: Pavel is a software engineer working on Google Chrome Developer Tools and WebKit's Inspector. He worked on Google Calendar prior to joining the Chrome team. Before joining Google, he was Chief Scientist at Borland working on modeling tools.

entry.title: Row: 29
entry.content: speakertitle: Reto Meier, speakercompany: Developer Advocate, speakerabstract: Reto is a Developer Advocate for Android at Google and the author of 'Professional Android 2 Application Development'. He works closely with Android developers, helping them understand Android and how to bring rich, compelling apps to the Android Market. An experienced software developer with more than 10 years of experience, he has worked in various places and industries, including offshore oil and gas in Australia and finance in London.

entry.title: Row: 30
entry.content: speakertitle: Roberto Ruju, speakercompany: Strategic Partner Development Manager, speakerabstract: Roberto is responsible for Google AdMob's strategic partnerships in the SEEMEA region, having joined Google as part of the AdMob acquisition in 2010, where he was previously Director of Business Development. Roberto has more than 12 years of mobile and media experience, predominantly in the areas of mobile advertising, marketing strategy, new product development, and telecommunication service launches. Prior to joining AdMob, Roberto was Head of Mobile Advertising for EMEA at Microsoft, having previously been at ScreenTonic, the European mobile advertising startup acquired by Microsoft in 2007. Prior to mobile advertising, he held positions at Gemini Consulting, Capgemini, and WebTv.

entry.title: Row: 31
entry.content: speakertitle: Roman Nurik, speakercompany: Developer Advocate, speakerabstract: Roman is an Android Developer Advocate at Google, focusing on user experience, visual design, and multimedia. He's quite handy at constructively criticizing mobile user interfaces! Previously, Roman worked on Google's geospatial developer products and engaged in web design and development work on a variety of independent projects.

entry.title: Row: 32
entry.content: speakertitle: Russell Buckley, speakercompany: AdMob Evangelist, speakerabstract: Russell champions the mobile channel for Google, communicating with publishers, developers and advertisers throughout the world. Previously, Russell was an early employee of AdMob, before it was acquired by Google in 2010. He has been in mobile marketing since 2000 and has subsequently been involved in thousands of campaigns. Before that he spent many years in marketing on both the agency and clientside. Russell is a previous Global Chairman of the Mobile Marketing Association, a founder of Mobile Monday in Germany and is a prolific writer about all things mobile.

entry.title: Row: 33
entry.content: speakertitle: Simon Meacham, speakercompany: Developer Advocate, speakerabstract: Simon Meacham is a Developer Advocate for Cloud Computing at Google. He focuses on helping Enterprise and ISV customers take advantage of the portfolio of Google technologies available for Cloud application development. Before joining Google he worked as a Developer and Technical Evangelist at Microsoft in Redmond, WA in Enterprise, Windows, Research and the Developer Tools Division. He received his BSc in Computer Science from the University of Durham, UK in 1996. He holds 5 patents in the area of software performance analysis.

entry.title: Row: 34
entry.content: speakertitle: Steven Bazyl, speakercompany: Developer Advocate, speakerabstract: Steve is a Developer Advocate at Google, focused on helping web application developers integrate with Google Apps and the Google Apps Marketplace. Prior to Google, he worked on building scalable and secure systems from networked gaming at IGT to identity and access management solutions at RSA Security.

entry.title: Row: 35
entry.content: speakertitle: Enrique Borras, speakercompany: Fiabee, CEO, speakerabstract: ...

entry.title: Row: 36
entry.content: speakertitle: Joan Serras, speakercompany: Fiabee, CTO, speakerabstract: ...

entry.title: Row: 37
entry.content: speakertitle: Martin Kleppe, speakercompany: Ubilabs GmbH, Head of Development, speakerabstract: Martin Kleppe (http://twitter.com/aemkei) loves travelling: virtually and in person. He graduated from Bauhaus-University, but had already discovered his passion for digital maps in the Internet long before this. He has been collecting every detail related to digital maps ever since. Today, he mainly works on technical implementation and turn-around of projects with new browser technologies. This year (2010) Martin also jointed jury for JavaScript Maps API of the Google Qualified Developer Programm (http://code.google.com/qualify/). Furthermore, Martin is co-founder and Head of Development of Ubilabs GmbH (http://ubilabs.net) in Hamburg, Germany. The company develops web-based map-applications based on Google Maps API for an international client base, e.g. Navigon, XING, BMW-Motorrad, Mare, and Olympus. Unilabs GmbH has also become famous for Tour-de-France Live Tracker oder loc.alize.us (one of the first Google Maps Mashups on Flickr).

entry.title: Row: 38
entry.content: speakertitle: Nenad Nikolic, speakercompany: XING AG, Product Manager, speakerabstract: ...

entry.title: Row: 39
entry.content: speakertitle: Stefan Richter, speakercompany: freiheit.com technologies gmbh, CEO, speakerabstract: Stefan is the founder and CTO of freiheit.com technologies gmbh. Since almost 12 years he and his now 70 employees are developing large internet applications for the Who-is-Who internet companies in germany and europe. He studied computer science and systems analysis because he fell in love with computer programming in 1983. His favorite programming languages are Common Lisp, Clojure and JavaScript. Besides that he loves books, photography and CrossFit. As a board member of pre-seed investor HackFwd he tries to help startups to become successful. As an activist he supports the Free Software movement and fights against software-patents in europe.
